parameters.name: DBInstanceId
parameters.description: The ID of the instance. You can call the [DescribeDBInstances](~~2628785~~) operation to query the IDs of instances.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: The description of the security group rule.

parameters.name: IpProtocol
parameters.description:
The type of the transport layer protocol. Valid values:

*   TCP
*   UDP

parameters.name: PortRange
parameters.description:
The range of destination ports over which TCP and UDP traffic is allowed in the security group rule.

Valid values: 1 to 65535. Separate the start port number and the end port number with a forward slash (/). Example: 1/200.

parameters.name: SecurityGroupRuleId
parameters.description: The ID of the security group rule. You can call the [DescribeDBInstanceSecurityGroupRule](~~2834044~~) to obtain the ID of the security group rule.

parameters.name: SourceCidrIp
parameters.description: The range of source IP addresses. CIDR blocks and IPv4 addresses are supported.
